pages.text: Despite being rather small compared to contemporary mainland relatives, Thecodontosaurus was actually a giant within the Mendip Archipelago of what is modern day England. The otherwise small size of this basal sauropodamorph is an instance of insular dwarfism. Thecodontosaurus was exclusive bipedal and a fast runner. Though Thecodontosaurus was mostly herbivorous, it is also possible that it also possessed more omnivorous traits.
